Sleak reports a resource leak. Here is how to

1) Open text editor
2) Make modification
3) Close it and say yes
4) Repeat 1), 2) and 3) several times
5) Snap Sleak
6) Repeat 1), 2) and 3)
7) Diff Sleak

This is a leak in the SWT image code. When createDisabledImage() is called the 
following is invoked

return new Image (display, image, SWT.IMAGE_DISABLE);

This image is not cleaned up when the ToolItem is destroyed.
There is code to clean up the image in ToolItem.releaseWidget.

Closing as WORKSFORME.  You need to dispose of the status line to see the 
resource getting released.

I'm unsuer what the meaning of "RESOLVED WORKSFORME" ? Still I could see this
leak, so I'm reopening it.
.

I will change it from WORKSFORME to INVALID. The image is not being leaked, 
the test case is not correct.

The image is not released until either 1) the toolitem is disposed or 2) a 
different image is set in the toolitem.  The toolitem you are seeing is part 
of the status line for the workbench.  It shows progress and allows you to 
cancel a task.  Closing the text editor does not cause the toolitem to be 
disposed - it just causes it to be made not visible.   Therefore, the image 
has not been released.  When the toolitem is disposed, the image will be 
released.  I do not think the toolitem will be disposed until you shut down 
eclipse.
